title: Wall Street opens higher on hopes of monetary stimulus
text: U.S. stocks opened higher for the fourth straight session on Monday, as mixed global economic data lifted expectations of monetary stimulus from central banks, including the U.S. Federal Reserve.

title: Dow opens slightly higher as Wall Street focuses on central-bank policy
text: U.S. stock-index benchmarks on Monday edged slightly higher as investors awaited news of further monetary-policy action from a number of central banks later this week and next.

title: U.S. Treasury chief weighing next steps amid French tax spat
text: The United States is meeting with technology and other companies as it considers its options following a row with Paris over France's tax on big internet firms, the U.S. Treasury secretary said on Monday.

title: Treasury's Mnuchin sees positive U.S. growth as China talks loom
text: U.S. Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin on Monday said he did not see the threat of a recession as the Trump administration seeks to revive trade negotiations with China, adding that he expected a positive year ahead for the U.S. economy.

title: Stocks gain on stimulus hopes, pound hits six-week high
text: Stocks gained on Monday as investors pinned their hopes on expected stimulus from the world's central banks to support slowing growth, while the pound hit a six-week high on hopes that Britain will not quit the EU without a deal.

title: The Coming Recession: Be Smart When Others Are Fearful

title: British Airways cancels 1,700 flights as pilots strike
text: British Airways (BA) pilots began a two-day strike on Monday, grounding nearly all of its flights and disrupting thousands of passengers in a dispute over pay.

title: Global stocks gain on hopes of central bank stimulus
text: Global stock markets gained on Monday as investors pinned their hopes on stimulus that's expected from the world's central banks to support slowing growth.

title: Redefining the Conversation about Investment Returns
text: Written by: Marc Odo | Swan Global Investments Trailing vs Rolling Returns In a world of instant updates and daily stock market news, investors often fixate on chasing short-term returns or “beating the market.” This leads to dependency on trailing returns to determine “how well” an investment is performing.

title: Oil markets want to see the 'strength' of Saudi Arabia's commitment to OPEC deal, Helima Croft says
text: All eyes will now be on Saudi Arabia's new energy minister to see if the country will stay the course on stabilizing global crude markets, oil market expert Helima Croft said.

title: Asia stocks gain as soft data lift stimulus hopes
text: Asian stocks edged higher on Monday amid a cautious mood as investors pinned their hopes on expected global stimulus to support slowing growth in the world's major economies.

title: Singapore stocks offer 'good yield' despite trade war jitters

title: US wants energy dominance regardless of what happens to oil prices, deputy energy secretary says
text: The U.S. deputy energy secretary told CNBC Monday that America wants to achieve energy dominance regardless of what happens to oil prices.

title: Should You Invest in Crypto Now?
text: I just finished reading Confessions of a Crypto Millionaire and the book made me think about cryptocurrency in a new and different way.  If, like me, you’ve been thinking that cryptocurrency is a scam that helps flash traders make a quick buck, you need to read about Dan Conway’s journey.
